item.title: Africa could become coronavirus epicentre
item.description: Africa has seen a 43 per cent jump in reported Covid-19 cases in the last week following a warning from the World Health Organisation that the continent of 1.3 billion could become the next epicentre of the pandemic.

item.title: Finland PM quarantined as virus precaution
item.description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin will work remotely after an employee at her official residence was discovered to have been in contact with someone infected with the coronavirus.

item.title: Facebook invests $9b in India digital firm
item.description: Facebook will spend $US5.7 billion ($A9.0 billion) for 10 per cent of Reliance Industries' digital business, as the social media firm looks to leverage its popular WhatsApp messenger to offer digital payment services to small grocers in India.

item.title: Accused Melbourne rapist wants freedom
item.description: A Melbourne man denies raping a woman his friends found passed out on a footpath, telling family members "consent is consent".

item.title: Vic child prostitution accused faces court
item.description: A Melbourne brothel manager accused of forcing a child into prostitution has appeared in court, but his two co-accused were no-shows.

item.title: Uber Eats drivers not employees: tribunal
item.description: A delivery driver kicked off the Uber Eats app wasn't an employee of the tech giant so can't be unfairly dismissed, the Full Bench of the Fair Work Commission has ruled.

item.title: Complaints mar Japan’s mask handout
item.description: Japan's effort to distribute protective cloth masks in its coronavirus battle has been marred by complaints about mould, insects, and stains, fuelling further concern that the government has botched its handling of the pandemic.

item.title: Microplastics found in Antarctic sea ice
item.description: Microplastics, such as those used in commercial fishing, have been discovered in Antarctic sea ice in what researchers say is a first.

item.title: Metro work continues at Sydney station
item.description: Major construction work is under way at Central Station as part of the Sydney Metro project, in the biggest upgrade to the city's busiest railway station in decades.

item.title: Turnbull sees tale as old and in line
item.description: Malcolm Turnbull believes his rampant quoting of text messages and private conversations in his new book is justified because he's talking about the past.
